net.proteusframework.core.automation

Class SQLDataConversion

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.core.automation.AbstractTask
      • net.proteusframework.core.automation.AbstractDataConversion
        • net.proteusframework.core.automation.SQLDataConversion
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DataConversion, Task

    public class SQLDataConversion
extends AbstractDataConversion
    SQL statement data conversion. Useful if your data conversion is just a simple list of SQL statements.
    Author:
    Russ Tennant (russ@proteus.co)

        Create a new instance.
        Parameters:
        identifier - the identifier.
        description - the description.
        version - the version.
        requiresDowntime - true if the data conversion requires the server to be stopped.
        dependencies - any dependencies on other data conversions.
        preDDL - SQL that needs to be run for schema changes.
        postDDL - SQL that needs to be run for schema changes.
        executeStatements - statements to be executed

        Create a new instance. SQL data conversion that doesn't require downtime or have DDL or conversion dependencies.

        identifier - the identifier.
        description - the description.
        version - the version.
        executeStatements - statements to be executed

      • execute

        public java.util.List<SQLStatement> execute(TaskArgument... arguments)
                                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                            java.lang.RuntimeException
        Description copied from interface: DataConversion
        The SQL statements returned should not include any DDL statements. DDL statements must be returned using DataConversion.getPreConversionDDL() or DataConversion.getPostConversionDDL() Execute the task using the specified arguments. Some tasks such as DataConversions, will execute SQL statements. Other tasks may do things, like send an email in which case they will not return SQL statements.
        Parameters:
        arguments - the arguments.
        Returns:
        an ordered list of loggable items from the task. If these are SQLStatements, the will be executed. Return an empty list if there or no loggable items.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the arguments are invalid.
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if an error happens during execution.
